name: Mary Had a Little Lamb
source: Traditional ABC notation - composed by Lowell Mason (1830s). ABC notation verified through multiple educational music sources.
notes: Traditional melody in C major for the first verse. The melody follows the classic pattern: E-D-C-D, E-E-E (rest), D-D-D (rest), E-G-G (rest), then repeats with variation. This is one of the most recognizable children's songs and is often used as a first melody for young music students. The same melody repeats for all verses of the song.
